page.title: 06THE RIVER WYE AT HOARWITHY
page.content: The beautiful river Wye rises in the Plynlimon Mountains in Mid Wales,and flows for 155 miles through scenic countryside to its junction with the river Severn at Chestow.The riverside village of Hoarwithy is almost mid-way alongthe length of the Wye on one of its characteristic meanders,which is crossed here by a narrow iron road bridge.The river is managed by the Welsh Water Authority,and is the onlyriver in England which has its entire length designated a SSSI(Site of Special Scientific Interest).The Wye is free of pollution where many varied species of plant and animal life can survive.At Hoarwithy the Wye provides an ideal recretional area for fishing,canoeing,walking,raft racing and camping.The quiet scenic river banks are also popular with bird watchers,painters and photographers.
